  de.icongmbh.oss.maven.plugin.javassist.ClassTransformer

MethodCallClassTransformer
public abstract class ClassTransformer
extends Object

Base class for class transformation logic.

Daniel Rochetti

Constructor Detail

ClassTransformer

public ClassTransformer()
Method Detail

applyTransformations

protected abstract void applyTransformations(javassist.CtClass classToTransform)
                                      throws Exception

Concrete implementations must implement all transformations on this method. You can use Javassist API to add/remove/replace methods, attributes and more. Only classes approved by #filter(CtClass) are considered.

Parameters:
classToTransform - The class to transform.
Throws:
Exception - if any error occur during the transformation.
See Also:
#filter(CtClass)

shouldTransform

protected boolean shouldTransform(javassist.CtClass candidateClass)
                           throws Exception

Test if the given class is suitable for applying transformations or not.

For example, if the class is a specific type:

 CtClass myInterface = ClassPool.getDefault().get(MyInterface.class.getName());
 return candidateClass.subtypeOf(myInterface);
Override this method to boost class transformations and discard classes you don't want to transform.

Parameters:
candidateClass -
Returns:
true if the Class should be transformed; false otherwise.
Throws:
Exception

configure

public void configure(Properties properties)
               throws Exception

Configure this instance by passing Properties.

Parameters:
properties - maybe null or empty
Throws:
Exception

transform

public final void transform(String dir)

Search for class files on the passed directory, load each one as CtClass, filter the valid candidates (using #filter(CtClass)) and apply transformation to each one (applyTransformations(CtClass)).

Limitation: do not search inside .jar files yet.

Parameters:
dir - root directory -input and output directory are the same.
See Also:
iterateClassnames(String), #transform(Iterator, String), applyTransformations(CtClass)

transform

public void transform(String inputDir,
                      String outputDir)

Search for class files on the passed input directory, load each one as CtClass, filter the valid candidates (using #filter(CtClass)) and apply transformation to each one (applyTransformations(CtClass)).

Limitation: do not search inside .jar files yet.

Parameters:
inputDir - root directory - required - if null or empty nothing will be transformed
outputDir - if null or empty the inputDir will be used
See Also:
iterateClassnames(String), #transform(Iterator, String), applyTransformations(CtClass)

transform

public final void transform(String inputDir,
                            String outputDir,
                            Iterator<String> classNames)

Use the passed className iterator, load each one as CtClass, filter the valid candidates (using #filter(CtClass)) and apply transformation to each one (applyTransformations(CtClass)).

Limitation: do not search inside .jar files yet.

Parameters:
inputDir - root directory - required - if null or empty nothing will be transformed
outputDir - must be not null
See Also:
applyTransformations(CtClass)

iterateClassnames

protected Iterator<String> iterateClassnames(String dir)

getLogger

protected static org.slf4j.Logger getLogger()

applyStamp

protected void applyStamp(javassist.CtClass candidateClass)
                   throws javassist.CannotCompileException
Apply a "stamp" to a class to indicate it has been modified. By default, this method uses a boolean field named as the stamp. Any class overriding this method should also override hasStamp(CtClass).

Parameters:
candidateClass - the class to mark/stamp.
Throws:
javassist.CannotCompileException
See Also:
#hasStamp(CtClass)}

removeStamp

protected void removeStamp(javassist.CtClass candidateClass)
                    throws javassist.CannotCompileException
Remove a "stamp" from a class if the "stamp" field is available. By default, this method removes a boolean field named . Any class overriding this method should also override hasStamp(CtClass).

Parameters:
candidateClass - the class to remove the mark/stamp from.
Throws:
javassist.CannotCompileException
See Also:
#hasStamp(CtClass)}, #applyStamp(CtClass)}

hasStamp

protected boolean hasStamp(javassist.CtClass candidateClass)
Indicates whether a class holds a stamp or not. By default, this method uses a boolean field named as the stamp. Any class overriding this method should also override applyStamp(CtClass).

Parameters:
candidateClass - the class to check.
Returns:
true if the class owns the stamp, otherwise false.
See Also:
applyStamp(CtClass)
